CatDescriptText: Mr. Mack Green, 513 Francis Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 4, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Sherman Adams was guilty of misconduct in office of assistant to the President? Do you think that he should have resigned?" answer reads: "I don't know what to say about the Sherman Adams' case, because I've heard so many different views about it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mack Green wearing bow tie, eyeglasses, moustache, and light colored hat with dark band, standing in front of store window displaying female mannequin, Gimbles in background, Smithfield Street, Downtown
